recipe.notes:
I consider this a fairly "short" recipe, meaning we're a little light on the mixture here, at least for 20 standard supermarket mushrooms. I usually just eyeball this one until the proportions look right: twice as much parsley as cheese and enough butter to hold it all together.
I generally like making the butter mixture ahead of time and leave it formed in a ball overnight to let the flavors develop a bit before removing it and resoftening to use. From the Garlic Festival Cookbook
recipe.name: Garlic Mushrooms
recipe.preparation:
Soften butter. Mix garlic, parsley, Parmesan and butter together and let sit. Clean and remove stems from the mushrooms. Fill caps with mixture and set in a 13"x9" glass dish.
Cook at 400F or under the broiler until the mushrooms begin to soften a bit. The crust will likely brown a bit, especially in the broiler.
